intro: Dendropanax poilanei, commonly known as the Polynesian arrowleaf, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, arrow-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
